title: Feature Request: configurable border size
author: sandrobosio78
body_snippet: Version 1.77 has a new panel docking system w.r.t. version 1.76. In the new version there are grey regions between the panels with a darker line in the middle. These regions separate horizontally and vertically the different panels. However, the same regions are also present at the sides and are particularly visible on the left/right/bottom borders of the application. They don't seem to play any particular function at those positions, and reduce the usable space. This feature request is to ask w...

iterations.description: Implement configurable border size for UI elements, starting with connection tabs, to enhance user customization and accessibility.

comments.author: jungleboydotca
comments.snippet:
I'll take this request one step further: In a single panel configuration (and perhaps even with multiple panels), it would be beneficial to be able to have the remote desktop extended to the very edge of the window.

Rationale: With the mRemote window maximized or otherwise snapped to the bottom of the screen it would allow for remote sessions and ui targets therein to have 'infinite height' and 'infinite width' in the case of the corners--a major usability enhancement.

notes:
AI triage (gemini): Implement configurable border size for UI elements, starting with connection tabs, to enhance user customization and accessibility.
Approach: Add a new configuration setting for border thickness. Update DockPaneStripNG.cs to use this setting when creating Pen objects for drawing borders. Add a UI element in FrmOptions for users to modify this setting.
